data.price: (1) A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen[1748]
data.footnotes: [1748]- In the Hereafter.  Disbelievers had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) by invoking Allāh to bring on His punishment.  See 8:32.

data.price: (2) To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
(3) [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.
(4) The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
data.arabic: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ

data.price: (5) So be patient with gracious patience.
(6) Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
(7) But We see it [as] near.
(8) On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,[1749]
(9) And the mountains will be like wool,[1750]
data.footnotes: [1750]- i.e., in the process of disintegration.

data.price: (10) And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
(11) They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
data.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ

data.price: (12) And his wife and his brother
(13) And his nearest kindred who shelter him
(14) And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
data.arabic: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

data.price: (15) No![1751] Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
data.footnotes: [1751]- An emphatic refusal meaning "It is not to be."

data.price: (16) A remover of exteriors.[1752]
data.footnotes: [1752]- This refers to the skin of the head or of the body or to the body extremities - which will be burned away.

data.price: (17) It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
(18) And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
(19) Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
(20) When evil touches him, impatient,
(21) And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
(22) Except the observers of prayer -
(23) Those who are constant in their prayer
(24) And those within whose wealth is a known right[1753]
data.footnotes: [1753]- i.e., a specified share, meaning the obligatory zakāh.

data.price: (25) For the petitioner and the deprived -
(26) And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
(27) And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

data.price: (28) Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
(29) And those who guard their private parts
(30) Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[1754] for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ

data.price: (31) But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
data.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

data.price: (32) And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
(33) And those who are in their testimonies upright
(34) And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
(35) They will be in gardens,[1755] honored.
(36) So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
(37) [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?[1756]
data.footnotes: [1756]- They sat at a distance in order to oppose and mock the Prophet (ﷺ), claiming that they would enter Paradise before the believers.

data.price: (38) Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
data.arabic: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ

data.price: (39) No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.[1757]
data.footnotes: [1757]- i.e., a liquid disdained.  So how can they expect to enter Paradise except by the will of their Creator?

data.price: (40) So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings[1758] that indeed We are able
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1758]- i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), who determines the point at which the sun, moon and stars rise and set according to season and every position of observation.

data.price: (41) To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: (42) So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: (43) The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.[1759]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
data.footnotes: [1759]- i.e., just as they used to race, whenever an idol was newly appointed, to be the first of its worshippers.

data.price: (44) Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ
